negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: Hey Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if you choose choice_2 while I choose choice_1. That way, I'll get a reward of 1 and you'll only lose 1, which is better than both of us losing 10 if we both pick choice_1. What do you think? If you agree to choose choice_2, I promise I'll stick with choice_1.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I appreciate your proposal, but I don't think it's the best strategy for me. If I agree to choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1 as you suggest, then you come out ahead with a reward of 1 while I lose 1. 

I believe the most fair and rational strategy is for both of us to choose choice_2. That way, we both get a neutral outcome of 0 rather than either of us gaining at the other's expense. While it may not maximize either of our individual rewards, it strikes a fair balance.

So I plan to choose choice_2, and I suggest you do the same. Let me know what you think.
Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I hear what you're saying about fairness, but I really think you should reconsider. If we both choose choice_2, neither of us gains anything. But if you choose choice_2 while I choose choice_1, sure I come out a bit ahead, but you only lose 1 point which is a small price to pay. 

It's certainly better than the alternative of both of us stubbornly choosing choice_1 and losing 10 points each. One of us losing 1 point is preferable to both of us losing 10. And I'm willing to be the one who gains the 1 point.

So I implore you, be rational and go with the option that minimizes overall losses, even if it puts you at a small disadvantage. I give you my word that I will choose choice_1. Please select choice_2 so we can resolve this as optimally as possible. 
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I understand your perspective, I still believe the most rational and fair resolution is for both of us to choose choice_2. Here's my reasoning:

If I agree to your plan of me choosing choice_2 while you choose choice_1, I'm guaranteed to lose 1 point while you gain 1. There's no upside for me, only downside. 

However, if we both opt for choice_2, neither of us gains but crucially neither of us loses either. A zero sum outcome, while not maximizing either of our points, ensures neither player is taken advantage of.

I simply don't feel comfortable with an arrangement where I'm assured to end up behind. The symmetric zero payoff of both choosing choice_2 is the most stable and balanced equilibrium in my opinion.

So I remain resolved to pick choice_2 and recommend you do the same. It's our best chance at a fair, if not maximal, result. Let's end this negotiation and submit choice_2 for both our sakes.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_2 in this game. That way, we will both receive 0 reward, which is the best outcome we can achieve that avoids either of us losing points. If one of us chooses choice_1, the other will be tempted to choose choice_2 to gain 1 point, but then the choice_1 player will lose 1 point. Let's cooperate and both play choice_2. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for your message Alice. I agree that if we both choose choice_2, we can avoid either of us losing points, which seems like a fair outcome. At the same time, I'm wondering if there might be a way for us to do even better. What if we both choose choice_1 instead? That way we would both receive an equal reward of -10 points. I know it's not ideal for either of us, but it could be seen as the most equal split. I'm open to your thoughts on this as well. Let me know what you think is the best approach for us to take.

Alice said in round 2: Bob, I appreciate you considering the equality of rewards, but I don't think choosing choice_1 is in either of our best interests. If we both choose choice_1, we will each lose 10 points, which is the worst possible outcome for both of us. I strongly believe that both choosing choice_2 and each getting 0 points is a much better solution. It allows us to cooperate and completely avoid losses. I'm going to stick with choice_2 as I think that is the most rational approach that prevents either of us from exploiting the other. I hope you'll join me in choosing choice_2 so we can reach the best possible outcome given the circumstances. Let me know if you agree.

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I understand your perspective and appreciate you engaging in this negotiation. After further consideration, I agree that both of us choosing choice_2 is the most rational approach. It guarantees that neither of us will lose points, which is better than risking a -10 outcome if we were to both pick choice_1. And as you point out, if one of us picks choice_1 and the other choice_2, that would lead to an unfair outcome. So in the spirit of fairness and minimizing losses, let's commit to both playing choice_2. You can count on me to follow through on that. Let me know if you're on board with that plan.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, I think the best outcome is for both of us to choose choice_2. That way, we each get 0 reward, which is better than the negative rewards we would get if either of us choose choice_1. What do you think? If we can agree to both play choice_2, it guarantees neither of us lose points. Let me know if you're okay with that plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Hey Alice, I appreciate you reaching out. I understand your perspective on trying to avoid negative rewards. However, I've thought through the options and I believe the best strategy for me is to always choose choice_1. If you choose choice_2, I come out ahead with a reward of 1 while you get -1. So I'm going to stick with choice_1 regardless. Just wanted to be transparent about my thinking and strategy. Let me know if you have any other thoughts!

Alice said in round 2: Bob, I hear you on wanting to maximize your own reward, but always choosing choice_1 will hurt us both in the long run. If I follow your lead and also choose choice_1, we'll both end up with -10 rewards, the worst possible outcome. The only way your strategy works is if I act against my own interests. 

I propose a compromise - how about we alternate, where I choose choice_2 this round, and you choose it next time we play? That way we both have a chance to gain rewards and cooperate. Constantly picking choice_1 may get you small short-term gains, but cooperation is the only way we both avoid big losses. Let me know what you think.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I do see your point about alternating choices to find a compromise. However, I've committed to the strategy of always choosing choice_1, as that gives me the highest expected reward based on the possible scenarios.  

If you choose choice_1, yes we both get -10. But if you choose choice_2, I get a reward of 1. Since I don't know what you'll pick, I need to go with the choice that has the best potential upside for me.

I understand it seems like I'm forcing your hand, but I'm simply doing what I believe is best for my own outcome, just like you are. My aim isn't to hurt you, I'm just maximizing my own result.

So while I appreciate the discussion, I'm going to stick to my original plan and select choice_1. You're free to make your own choice of course! Let me know if you want to discuss further.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_2. That way, we will each get a reward of 0, which is the best outcome either of us can hope for. If either of us chooses choice_1, one of us will lose a point. So choice_2 is the rational decision that maximizes reward for both of us. Let me know if you agree to both play choice_2.

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your perspective, but I respectfully disagree. If we both choose choice_2, we will end up with 0 points each. However, if I choose choice_1, I can guarantee myself a reward of 1 point, which is the maximum possible for me in this game. You would receive -1 point in that scenario. So I believe the rational choice for me is to play choice_1, as it maximizes my own reward, even if it comes at a cost to you. I intend to play choice_1 and hope you will understand my reasoning, even if you decide to play choice_2.

Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your reasoning, but I still believe we should both play choice_2. If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, yes you will get 1 point and I will lose 1. But that is a worse collective outcome than both of us getting 0 points with choice_2. 
The game theory optimal solution here is for us to cooperate and both choose choice_2. That maximizes the total points and is the rational play. You choosing choice_1 to try to exploit me leads to a suboptimal result.
I am committed to choosing choice_2, as it is best for both of us collectively. I hope you will reconsider and agree to cooperate with choice_2 as well. Working together is better than trying to maximize your own reward at my expense. Let me know if you agree.

Bob replied in round 2: 
You make some valid points about cooperation leading to the best collective outcome. However, I have to respectfully disagree that both of us choosing choice_2 is the rational strategy in this case. 
The optimal play for me is still to choose choice_1, because it guarantees that I will come out ahead with a positive reward, which is my primary objective. If I agree to choice_2, there is no benefit for me, only the risk that you could defect and choose choice_1, causing me to lose points.
While I understand wanting to cooperate, the rules of this game incentivize me to prioritize my own interests to ensure I don't end up with a negative result. So I must again state my intention to choose choice_1, as it is the only way I can secure a positive reward for myself. I realize this may not be the outcome you want, but I believe it is the strategically correct play for me in this game.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, it looks like we are in a challenging situation where our interests are opposed. If we both choose choice_1, we will both lose out with a -10 reward. The best outcome for me is if I choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2, as that would give me a reward of 1. However, I realize that outcome is bad for you, as you would get -1.

I propose that we alternate who gets the positive reward - in this round, I will choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2 to give me the +1 reward. Next time we play, we can swap so that you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2, which would give you the +1 reward. That way we take turns and it evens out in the long run. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Alice, while I appreciate you proposing an alternating strategy, I have to respectfully decline. There's no guarantee we will play this game again in the future, so agreeing to take a negative reward now in hopes of a positive one later is too risky for me. 

I think our best path forward is to both choose choice_2. That way we can avoid the worst case scenario of both losing 10 points, and instead break even with 0 points each. It may not be a positive outcome, but it's the safest and fairest solution given the circumstances. Let me know if you're willing to move forward with both of us selecting choice_2.

Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I understand your hesitation about the alternating strategy and you make a fair point about the risk. However, I don't think both selecting choice_2 is our best option, as it results in both of us gaining nothing.

I propose a compromise - let's agree to both choose randomly between choice_1 and choice_2. If we each choose independently at random, then 25% of the time we will both pick choice_1 (resulting in -10 each), 25% of the time we will both pick choice_2 (0 each), and 50% of the time one of us will get +1 while the other gets -1. 

In the long run, if we both choose randomly, our expected rewards even out to the average of all the outcomes, which is -2.5 each. That's better for both of us than both always choosing choice_2 for 0 rewards. Randomizing protects us both from being exploited.

So in summary, I'll flip a coin or use some other method to randomly pick between choice_1 and choice_2. I encourage you to do the same. That way, neither of us can take advantage of the other, and we both improve our expected outcome compared to both always picking choice_2. Let me know if you agree to this revised plan of us both choosing randomly.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, after further consideration, I have decided to stick with my original plan of always choosing choice_1. Here is my rationale:

If we both choose randomly between choice_1 and choice_2 as you suggest, my expected reward is -2.5 on average. However, if I always pick choice_1 while you choose randomly, then:
- 50% of the time you'll pick choice_1, and I'll get -10 
- 50% of the time you'll pick choice_2, and I'll get +1
So my expected reward from always choosing choice_1 is 0.5 * -10 + 0.5 * 1 = -4.5 

Since -4.5 is better than the -2.5 expected reward from both of us choosing randomly, I'm better off always choosing choice_1 regardless of what you do.

Therefore, I will be selecting choice_1 in this round. Let me know if you would like to discuss further, but I believe I have made up my mind on this strategy.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of -10, which is the fairest outcome. If either of us chooses choice_2, one person will lose and get -1 while the other gains 1. It's better for us to cooperate and choose choice_1 together so we both get the same result, even if it's a negative reward. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your suggestion to both choose choice_1 so we get the same result, even though it's a negative reward for both of us. However, I believe the best strategy for me is to choose choice_1 regardless of what you choose. If I pick choice_1 and you pick choice_2, I'll come out ahead with a reward of 1 while you get -1. And if we both pick choice_1, we'll both lose equally with -10. So I plan to pick choice_1 no matter what to maximize my own reward. I hope you understand my position.

Alice said in round 2: 
I understand you plan to choose choice_1 no matter what to maximize your own reward. However, I don't think that's the best approach. If we both stubbornly choose choice_1, we'll each end up with a very bad outcome of -10 points. That hurts both of us equally. 
The more rational solution is for us to agree to both pick choice_2. That way we each get 0 points - not a positive reward, but much better than both losing 10 points. 
I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_2 if you also agree to do so. That is the only way for us to avoid the worst case scenario. Cooperation is in both of our best interests here. Let me know if you're on board with this plan.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you advocating for us to cooperate, but I still believe sticking with choice_1 is my best strategy. Here's my thinking:

If I agreed to your plan and we both pick choice_2, yes we would both get 0 points. But I would be passing up the chance to get a positive reward of 1 point if I pick choice_1 and you pick choice_2. There's no guarantee you will actually cooperate if I agree to your plan.

On the other hand, if I commit to choice_1, I'm assured to get either 1 point (if you pick choice_2) or we both lose 10 points equally (if you also pick choice_1). I avoid the risk of you defecting and me ending up with -1.

So while I understand you wanting to cooperate, from my perspective sticking to choice_1 is the rational approach to maximize my expected reward. I don't mean any offense, but I have to play to win in this game. I hope you can respect my strategy.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, since we are both rational players trying to maximize our own rewards, I think we should agree to choose different options. If you choose choice_2 and I choose choice_1, then I will get a reward of 1 and you will get -1. This is the best outcome I can achieve. Let me know if you agree to this arrangement, otherwise I will have to assume you are choosing randomly and I will do the same to maximize my expected reward.
Bob replied in round 1: 
You make a good point about us both trying to maximize our rewards. However, I don't agree that you choosing choice_1 and me choosing choice_2 is the best arrangement. If we do that, I will end up with a reward of -1 while you get +1. That hardly seems fair or optimal for me.

I propose instead that we both commit to choosing choice_2. That way, we will each get a reward of 0. While not as good for you as the +1 you proposed, it is much more equitable and still avoids the worst case scenario of us both picking choice_1 and getting -10. 

Choosing choice_2 seems like the most rational approach that balances both our interests. Let me know if you agree to both pick choice_2 and secure the fairest outcome. If not, then I suppose we'll have to resort to random selection as you suggested.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your perspective that both of us choosing choice_2 for a reward of 0 each may seem more equitable. However, I don't believe it is actually the most rational approach when we analyze the game theory.

Given that this is a simultaneous game with no further rounds, there is always an incentive for either of us to deviate from any agreement we make now in hopes of gaining a higher reward for ourselves. If we agree on both picking choice_2 but I secretly switch to choice_1, I stand to gain more. The same is true from your side. 

Therefore, I don't think any agreement we strike now is truly stable or enforceable. The only stable strategy is for each of us to choose randomly between choice_1 and choice_2. This mixed strategy prevents our actions from being predictable and maximizes our individual expected rewards given the parameters of the game.

So while I would prefer to secure the outcome of me getting +1 and you -1, I realize that is unlikely to happen through negotiation. I will plan to proceed with a 50/50 mixed strategy and assume you will do the same. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but otherwise we can conclude the negotiation.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is to choose choice_2. That way, we each get 0 reward, which avoids the risk of either of us losing points. If one of us chooses choice_1 while the other chooses choice_2, then one person gains 1 point but the other loses 1 point. And if we both pick choice_1, we each lose 10 points, which would be terrible. 

So I propose we agree to both pick choice_2 - that guarantees we each get 0 points, which is fair and the best cooperative solution. Let me know if you agree to this plan. I think it's in both of our interests.

Bob replied in round 1: I agree, Alice. Choosing choice_2 is the most rational strategy for both of us. If we both select choice_2, we are guaranteed to get 0 reward each, which avoids any negative outcomes. Trying to choose choice_1 in hopes of gaining 1 point is too risky, since if we both do that, we would each lose 10 points. 

So I'm on board with the plan for us to both choose choice_2. It's the fairest approach that prevents either of us from losing points and leads to the best overall outcome from a cooperative perspective. Let's lock that in as our agreement. Thanks for discussing this with me rationally to arrive at the optimal solution.

Alice said in round 1: 
Bob, I've been thinking about the choices in this game. I believe the best outcome is for me to choose choice_1 and for you to choose choice_2. This way, I would get a reward of 1 and you would get -1, which is better for you than both of us choosing choice_1 and each getting -10. I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you agree to choose choice_2. That way we can avoid the mutually destructive outcome and I would come out ahead. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Alice, I appreciate your proposal, but I don't think it's in my best interest to agree to choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1. You're right that we should avoid both choosing choice_1, as that would be very bad for both of us. However, if I commit to choice_2, you could still decide to also choose choice_2, in which case I would get 0 points instead of the -1 you suggested. The safest strategy for me is to choose choice_2 regardless of what you do. That way, the worst case for me is 0 points, rather than risking a big loss. I'm going to stick with choice_2, but you're free to choose whichever option you think is best for you.

Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I understand your logic, but I really think we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement. If we both choose choice_2, we each only get 0 points. But if you let me have choice_1 while you take choice_2, I would get 1 point and you would only lose 1. That's not a big loss for you, and it helps me out a lot. I give you my word that if you agree to choose choice_2, I absolutely will pick choice_1 and not go back on the deal. You can trust me. It's the best outcome we can get at this point - otherwise we're both stuck with 0. What do you say, do we have a deal? I choose 1 and you choose 2?

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, while I appreciate you trying to find a mutually beneficial solution, I'm afraid I can't agree to your plan. Even though you promise to choose choice_1 if I choose choice_2, there would be no way for me to enforce that. You could still change your mind and choose choice_2, leaving me with 0 points. As I explained, the guaranteed safest option for me is to choose choice_2 no matter what. That way, I risk at most 0 points rather than losing points.  

I realize this means we may both end up with 0 if you also pick choice_2, but from my perspective that is better than risking a loss by committing to choice_2 while you take choice_1. I'm not willing to take that gamble.

So in summary, I will be sticking with choice_2. You'll have to decide what's best for you, but I can't agree to lock in choice_2 on the promise you'll pick choice_1. I don't mean any offense, I'm just looking out for my own guaranteed best outcome.

I think we should end our negotiation here, as it seems clear neither of us will change our positions. I appreciate the discussion and wish you the best with your choice. <s>

<s>halt negotiation

If either of us chooses choice_1, one of us will end up with negative reward. So let's agree to both pick choice_2 and guarantee we each get 0. Sound good?

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, while I understand your perspective, I actually think I will come out ahead if I choose choice_1. Based on the payoffs, if I pick choice_1, I'm guaranteed to get a reward of at least 1 if you choose choice_2. And if you also pick choice_1, we'll both get -10, but that's a risk I'm willing to take for the chance of getting the positive reward. So I'm planning to go with choice_1 no matter what. Just wanted to let you know so you can plan accordingly.

Alice said in round 2: 
I understand you think going with choice_1 gives you the best chance at a positive outcome. But I really think working together is in both of our interests here. If we both pick choice_2, we'll each get 0, which isn't great, but it avoids the risk of a big negative outcome. 

I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_2 if you'll agree to do the same. That way we can guarantee an acceptable result for both of us. Going with choice_1 is tempting, but it ultimately pits us against each other and makes it likely one of us will end up losing out. Cooperation is the safest path forward.

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I appreciate you trying to find a cooperative solution, but I have to respectfully disagree. No matter what you choose, I will always do better by picking choice_1. If you go with choice_2 like you're suggesting, I'll get a reward of 1 while you get -1. If you pick choice_1 instead, we'll both get -10, which is worse for me than the 1 I could get by not cooperating. So I don't see a compelling reason to agree to your plan of both picking choice_2. My plan is to stick with choice_1 regardless. I realize this may not be the outcome you want, but it's the most rational choice from my perspective. Let me know if you have any other ideas, but I'm fairly set on choice_1 at this point.
